11111.title: Pasta with Garlic, Scallions, Cauliflower & Breadcrumbs
11111.summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Pasta with Garlic, Scallions, Cauliflower & Breadcrumbs a try.
instructions: Prepare the Ingredients: Thaw and cut the cauliflower florets into bite-sized pieces if they are not already prepared. Peel and finely chop the garlic cloves. Chop the scallions, separating the white and green parts. Grate the cheese if not pre-grated.

Cook the Pasta: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta, reserving about 1 cup of the pasta water, and set aside.

Prepare the Breadcrumbs: In a large pan, heat 1 tablespoon of butter over medium heat. Add the breadcrumbs and toast them until golden brown and crisp. Remove the breadcrumbs from the pan and set them aside.

Cook the Vegetables: In the same pan, heat the extra virgin olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes. Add the white parts of the scallions and cook for another 2 minutes. Add the cauliflower florets to the pan and cook until they are tender and starting to brown, about 5-7 minutes.

Combine the Ingredients: Add the cooked pasta to the pan with the vegetables. Pour in the white wine and cook for another 2-3 minutes until the alcohol evaporates. Add the reserved pasta water a little at a time to create a sauce, stirring well to coat the pasta.

Season and Serve: Stir in the grated cheese and red pepper flakes (if using). Season with salt and pepper to taste. Remove from heat and sprinkle the toasted breadcrumbs and the green parts of the scallions over the top. Serve immediately.

extendedIngredients.name: cauliflower florets
extendedIngredients.original: about 2 cups frozen cauliflower florets, thawed, cut into bite-sized pieces
extendedIngredients.originalName: about frozen cauliflower florets, thawed, cut into bite-sized pieces

extendedIngredients.name: couple of pepper flakes
extendedIngredients.original: couple of pinches red pepper flakes, optional
extendedIngredients.originalName: couple of red pepper flakes, optional

extendedIngredients.name: scallions
extendedIngredients.original: 3 scallions, chopped, white and green parts separated
extendedIngredients.originalName: scallions, chopped, white and green parts separated

extendedIngredients.name: bread crumbs
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup whole wheat bread crumbs (I used panko)
extendedIngredients.originalName: whole wheat bread crumbs (I used panko)

77777.title: Moroccan Chickpea Stew
77777.summary: Moroccan Chickpea Stew is a hearty and flavorful dish made with chickpeas, tomatoes, and a blend of Moroccan spices. It's perfect for a nutritious and comforting meal. This recipe is my grandmother's. It is customary to prepare it on Saturdays
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sliced carrots, and cook until softened.
Add the diced tomatoes, cooked chickpeas, ground cumin, ground cinnamon, ground coriander, salt, and pepper. Stir well to combine.
Add enough water to cover the ingredients, bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
Garnish with fresh chopped cilantro before serving.

88888.title: Persian Herb Frittata (Kuku Sabzi)
88888.summary: Persian Herb Frittata, known as Kuku Sabzi, is a traditional Persian dish packed with fresh herbs and flavor. It's a perfect dish for a light meal or appetizer. This recipe is my grandmother's. It is usually prepared on holidays
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F (175C).
In a large bowl, whisk the eggs until well beaten.
Add the fresh chopped herbs, minced garlic, chopped green onions, salt, and black pepper to the eggs. Mix well.
Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Pour the egg and herb mixture into the skillet.
Cook on the stovetop for about 5 minutes, then transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, until fully set.
Remove from oven, let cool slightly, and slice into wedges to serve.

99999.title: Moroccan Lamb Tagine
99999.summary: Moroccan Lamb Tagine is a rich and flavorful stew made with lamb, dried fruits, and a variety of spices, slow-cooked to perfection. It's a traditional Moroccan dish that's perfect for a special occasion. This recipe is my grandmother's. It is usually prepared on holidays
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot or tagine over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened.
Add the minced garlic and cubed lamb, and cook until the lamb is browned on all sides.
Stir in the ground cumin, ground cinnamon, ground coriander, salt, and pepper. Cook for another 2 minutes.
Add the dried apricots and prunes, and enough water to cover the ingredients. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour, until the lamb is tender.
Serve hot with couscous or bread.
